text: DYK? This was the very first time the chaotix detectives were present in a sonic game and also: Charmy (the Bee) back then was 16 years old but in his reappearance he got changed to 6(!)
author: Evilriku13

text: For some reason I thought you posted this years ago. This is basically the song people default to when they think of this game. A shame this game and Sonic CD went for years suffering cancelled rereleases until SEGA ended part of the trend with CD. Now I'm still waiting for this game in a SEGA compilation or on an online game store.

author: DScribbleF

text: The first 32X entry in the list. I remember we actually had this Genesis add-on but I weirdly have no recollection of the games we owned. I never played this game and heard it's solid, but I've seen a lot of complaints concerning the forced "rubber-band" buddy system that hinders the gameplay. Definitely a strange design decision on Sega's part.
author: SupraDarky

text: @SupraDarky Never heard of it, but it looks like a dumb Sonic the Hedgehog ripoff.
author: Jirt

text: @Mdude360 It's not a rip-off. It's basically an official Sonic game.
author: Burkhart von Klitzing

text: Many people like it, but it's not my cup of tea. Nevertheless, it has pleasent soundtrack.
author: Radoslav Mitrov

text: @Burkhart von Klitzing Eh, that's the joke.
author: Jirt

text: @SupraDarky The buddy system is one of the problems, but the other one is that the levels go on for 5 acts, and these acts and partners are selected semi-randomly. Also some levels have pretty annoying gimmicks
author: Duskool

text: The only good 32X game.
author: Yoshifreak2000

text: Stellar Assault, Blackthorne, Kolibri, After Burner, Space Harrier, MK2, WWF Wrestlemania Arcade, are all good games.. some of them, even great...
author: Radoslav Mitrov

text: @Yoshifreak2000 No it's not. However it's one of the better games for the 32X
